Additional: Calculus-based introduction to Newtonian mechanics. Kinematics and dynamics of particles and systems of particles, conservation laws, rotational motion, gravitation, and oscillatory motion. Pre-requisites: credit or concurrent enrollment in MTH 141 and PHY 273. Intended for science and engineering majors. Textbook: University Physics (OpenStax), 1st Edition, Volume 1. The course satisfies URI's general education areas: Scientific, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematical Disciplines (Full); and Mathematical, Statistical, or Computational Strategies (Partial). Additional information includes policies on Brightspace, examination schedules, homework assignments, grading schemes, recitation requirements, anti-bias statements, disability services, academic enhancement resources, and COVID-19 protocols.
